title: StatQuest Workshop Overview
text: Welcome to StatQuest! This course will cover the fundamental descriptive statistics (frequencies, central tendencies, and variability of data) and inferential statistics (t-test and ANOVA*) students will encounter in different fields of research. Students of this course will be introduced to an open-source statistical program to analyze and interpret quantitative data (R).

title: StatQuest Workshop Overview
text: Welcome to StatQuest! This course will cover the fundamental descriptive statistics (frequencies, central tendencies, and variability of data) and inferential statistics (t-test and ANOVA*) students will encounter in different fields of research. Students of this course will be introduced to an open-source statistical program to analyze and interpret quantitative data (R).

title: StatQuest Workshop Overview
text:
Workshop Format
Hybrid, [Future Dates TBD] 10 am, to 12 pm, Weaver Science and Engineering Library Rm 212.  Zoom Link: [TBA]. If you would like to sign up for the survey or workshop, please go to this link [here].

title: StatQuest Workshop Overview
text:
Learning Outcomes
By the end of this course, students will:

Describe fundamental concepts in research design and basic statistical techniques used in quantitative research.
Apply statistical methods using R to organize, analyze, and interpret quantitative data from sample research scenarios.
Create clear and effective data visualizations and research summaries that communicate key findings using R and best practices for reporting.

title: StatQuest Workshop Overview
text:
Recommended Readings:

[Descriptive Statistics] Antoine Soetewey. Descriptive Statistics in R. Blog 2020.

See the UArizona Libraries loaner technology if you need a loaner laptop.

title: Install R/RStudio
text:
First you need to install R itself (the engine).

Go to the CRAN (Collective R Archive Network) website: https://cran.r-project.org/



Click on ‚ÄúDownload R for XXX‚Äù, where XXX is either Mac or Windows:

If you use macOS, scroll down to the first¬†.pkg¬†file in the list of files (in this picture, it‚Äôs¬†R-4.5.0.pkg; as of right now, the current version is 4.5.0) and download it.

If you use Windows, click ‚Äúbase‚Äù (or click on the bolded ‚Äúinstall R for the first time‚Äù link) and download it.

Double click on the downloaded file. Click yes through all of the prompts.

title: Install R/RStudio
text:
Install RStudio
Next, you need to install RStudio, the nicer graphical user interface (GUI) for R (the dashboard). Once R and RStudio are both installed, you can ignore R and only use RStudio. RStudio will use R automatically and you won‚Äôt ever have to interact with it directly.

Go to the free download location on RStudio‚Äôs website: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download
The website should automatically detect your operating system (macOS or Windows) and show a big download button for it:


If not, scroll down a little to the large table and choose the version of RStudio that matches your operating system.

Double click on the downloaded file (again, check your Downloads folder). Click yes through all the prompts to install like any other program.

Double click on RStudio to run it (check your applications folder or start menu).
